User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the OmniPost AI platform.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was last updated.

SocialMediaAccount.title: SocialMediaAccount
SocialMediaAccount.description: Represents a social media account connected to a user's OmniPost AI account.

id.description: Unique identifier for the social media account.

platform.description: The social media platform (e.g., Instagram, Facebook, X).

username.description: The username of the social media account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the social media account was connected.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the social media account was last updated.

Post.title: Post
Post.description: Represents a social media post created and managed within OmniPost AI.

content.description: The text content of the post.

mediaUrl.description: URL of the media file associated with the post, if any.

status.description: The status of the post (e.g., Scheduled, Published, Draft).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was last updated.

scheduledAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post is scheduled to be published, if applicable.

PlatformPost.title: PlatformPost
PlatformPost.description: Represents a social media post created and managed within OmniPost AI.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Platform post.

publishedAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the post was published.

status.description: The status of the Platform post (e.g., Published, Error).

Subscription.title: Subscription
Subscription.description: Represents a subscription plan for OmniPost AI.

id.description: Unique identifier for the subscription plan.

name.description: Name of the subscription plan (e.g., Free, Pro, Agency).

price.description: Monthly price of the subscription plan.

accountLimit.description: Maximum number of social media accounts allowed for the subscription plan.

postLimit.description: Maximum number of scheduled posts allowed per month.

analyticsLevel.description: Level of analytics available for the subscription plan.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support the OmniPost AI platform's core features, emphasizing authorization independence, scalability, and security. It leverages path-based ownership for user-specific data and a membership map model for collaborative data. Denormalization is employed to avoid `get()` calls in security rules and to ensure atomic operations.

1.  **User Data:** User profiles are stored under `/users/{userId}`, providing straightforward ownership-based access control.
2.  **Social Media Accounts:** Social media accounts owned by users are stored in `/users/{userId}/socialMediaAccounts/{accountId}`, ensuring that only the user can manage their connected accounts. This path-based structure makes security rules simple and efficient.
3.  **Posts:** Posts created by users are stored in `/users/{userId}/posts/{postId}`. This structure maintains clear ownership and simplifies security rules. Each `Post` document contains the `userId`, which is denormalized for authorization independence. Posts intended for specific platforms (e.g., Instagram, Facebook) are represented via `platformPosts`.
4.  **Platform Posts:** Platform-specific post instances are located in `/users/{userId}/posts/{postId}/platformPosts/{platformPostId}`. Each `PlatformPost` stores a reference to the parent `Post` and `socialMediaAccountId`. This design allows efficient querying and management of published posts on different platforms, with clear ownership inherited from the parent `Post`.
5.  **Subscriptions:** Subscription plans are stored in `/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}`. Since subscriptions are global and not user-specific, a dedicated top-level collection is used. User's `subscriptionId` is stored on `/users/{userId}`.

This structure achieves Authorization Independence by denormalizing the user ID into the `Post` documents. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules when validating access to posts. The use of path-based ownership ensures that list operations can be securely implemented by scoping queries to the user's collection. The segregation of data based on ownership (`/users/{userId}`) supports the required QAPs by allowing secure filtering and listing of resources.
